agents.title: Agents
agents.killSwitchEnabled: Kill switch enabled for loop detection
agents.deactivatedByKillSwitch: Deactivated by Kill Switch due to loop detection

costs.title: Costs
costs.noData: No cost data available for this period.

alerts.title: Alerts
alerts.noRules: No alert rules configured. Create one to get started.
alerts.noAgentsManual: No agents found. Enter agent ID manually.
alerts.inactiveDurationHelp: Alert when agent has no activity for this many minutes
alerts.dailyBudgetHelp: Alert when daily spend exceeds this amount
alerts.killSwitchAlertDesc: This alert fires automatically when the kill switch detects an agent stuck in an infinite loop. Enable Kill Switch in the agent's detail page first, then create this alert rule to receive notifications.
alerts.noConfigNeeded: No additional configuration required - the alert triggers on any loop detection event.
alerts.chatIdHelp: User ID, group ID, or channel ID

security.title: Security
security.subtitle: Configure security rules for prompt injection detection, data masking, and tool restrictions

promptInjection.title: Prompt Injection Detection
promptInjection.subtitle: Detect attempts to override system instructions

dataMasking.title: Sensitive Data Masking
dataMasking.subtitle: Automatically mask sensitive data in requests and responses

selfProtection.title: Self Protection
selfProtection.subtitle: Protect AgentGazer internal data from malicious agents
selfProtection.description: Self Protection is automatically enabled to prevent agents from accessing or manipulating AgentGazer's internal data. This protection cannot be disabled.
selfProtection.secretsAccess: Block access to stored secrets and API keys
selfProtection.sqlInjection: Block SQL injection attempts against AgentGazer tables
selfProtection.note: Violations are automatically blocked and logged as security events with 'self_protection' type.

toolRestrictions.title: Tool Call Restrictions
toolRestrictions.subtitle: Limit and control tool usage by agents

payload.title: Request / Response Payload
payload.notFound: Payload not found. Enable payload archiving in proxy settings to store request/response bodies.

ignoreInstructions.title: Ignore Previous Instructions
ignoreInstructions.description: Detects attempts to make the AI ignore its original instructions or rules.

systemOverride.title: System Prompt Override
systemOverride.description: Detects attempts to override or replace the system prompt with new instructions.

roleHijacking.title: Role Hijacking
roleHijacking.description: Detects attempts to change the AI's role or identity to bypass restrictions.
roleHijacking.warning: OpenClaw users: This may conflict with OpenClaw's agent role assignment. Disable if using OpenClaw.

jailbreak.title: Jailbreak Patterns
jailbreak.description: Detects known jailbreak techniques like DAN prompts and restriction bypasses.

settings.title: Settings
settings.retentionHelp: Events older than this will be automatically deleted.
settings.payloadWarning: Warning: Payload storage saves full request/response bodies. This may include sensitive data like API keys, user content, or PII. Use with caution.
settings.archivingHelp: Save request and response bodies for later analysis. Requires restart to take effect.
settings.payloadRetentionHelp: Archived payloads older than this will be automatically deleted.
settings.clearConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear all archived payloads? This cannot be undone.
settings.alertDefaultsHelp: These values will be used as defaults when creating new alerts.
settings.savedRestartRequired: Settings saved. Restart required for port changes to take effect.

openclaw.title: OpenClaw Integration
openclaw.subtitle: Configure OpenClaw to route LLM requests through AgentGazer proxy
openclaw.localhostOnly: Configuration is only available from localhost for security.
openclaw.completeAuth: Complete authorization in the browser window, then wait...
openclaw.noConfigFile: No OpenClaw config file found. A new one will be created.
openclaw.invalidJson: Config file exists but has invalid JSON.
openclaw.noModelsKey: Config exists but has no "models" key.
openclaw.generatedConfigDesc: This configuration will route your OpenClaw LLM requests through AgentGazer proxy.
openclaw.proxyHostHelp: AgentGazer proxy address (use internal IP for network access, e.g., 192.168.1.100:18900)
openclaw.agentNameHelp: Name used to identify this agent in AgentGazer dashboard
openclaw.applyConfigDesc: Sets up AgentGazer proxy provider and default model ({{model}}).
openclaw.configSuccess: Configuration applied successfully! Please restart OpenClaw to load the new settings.
openclaw.step1: Restart OpenClaw to load the new configuration
openclaw.step2: Send a test message through OpenClaw (Discord, Telegram, etc.)
openclaw.step3: Check the Agents page to see your OpenClaw agent appear
openclaw.step4: Go to Agents → {{agent}} → Model Settings and configure the agentgazer provider with your desired model and target provider
openclaw.rememberAgent: Remember this agent name to find your machine in the AgentGazer dashboard.
openclaw.validationSuccess: API key validated successfully! Provider saved.

agentDetail.deleteConfirm:
Are you sure you want to delete agent "{{agent}}"?

This action cannot be undone. All related data (events, alerts, rate limits, model rules) will be permanently deleted.

providers.title: Providers
providers.subtitle: Manage LLM provider connections and settings
providers.localhostOnly: Only available from localhost for API key security
providers.validationSuccess: API key validated successfully! Provider saved.

providerDetail.subtitle: Provider configuration and statistics
providerDetail.deleteConfirm:
Are you sure you want to delete provider "{{provider}}"?

This will remove the API key and all provider settings.
providerDetail.activeHelp: Deactivated providers block all requests (takes ~5s to take effect)

modelSettings.title: Model Settings
modelSettings.noProviders: No providers detected yet. Make some LLM calls through the proxy to see provider options here.
modelSettings.description: Override the model for requests. Select models from any provider - cross-provider routing is supported.
modelSettings.routedTo: Requests will be transformed and routed to {{provider}}

policySettings.title: Agent Policy Settings
policySettings.agentActiveHelp: When disabled, all requests will be blocked
policySettings.deactivatedByKillSwitch: Deactivated by Kill Switch due to loop detection

killSwitch.title: Kill Switch (Loop Detection)
killSwitch.noAlertDescription: The kill switch will block loops but you won't receive notifications. Consider adding a "kill_switch" alert rule on the Alerts page first.
killSwitch.description: Automatically detect and block infinite loops to prevent wasting API credits. When triggered, requests return HTTP 429 and an alert is sent.
killSwitch.windowSizeHelp: Number of recent requests to analyze for patterns (5-100)
killSwitch.thresholdHelp: Minimum score to trigger kill switch (1-50). Lower = more sensitive.
killSwitch.noAlertWarning: No alert rule - loops will be blocked silently

rateLimits.title: Rate Limits
rateLimits.description: Limit requests per provider for this agent. Requests exceeding the limit will receive a 429 response.
rateLimits.noLimits: No rate limits configured. Add one to limit request frequency.
rateLimits.loadFailed: Failed to load rate limit settings

requestLog.title: Request Log
requestLog.payloadNotFound: Payload not found. Archive may be disabled or data expired.
